name: Introduction to Microeconomics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of microeconomics. Topics include supply and demand, consumer theory, production and costs, market structure, and welfare economics.

name: Introduction to Macroeconomics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of macroeconomics. Topics include national income accounting, inflation, unemployment, economic growth, monetary policy, and fiscal policy.

name: Intermediate Microeconomics
description: This course builds on Introduction to Microeconomics and covers more advanced topics in microeconomics, including general equilibrium, game theory, market failures, and externalities.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course builds on Introduction to Macroeconomics and covers more advanced topics in macroeconomics, including business cycles, international trade, open economy macroeconomics, and economic growth.

name: Econometrics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of econometrics, the application of statistical methods to economic data. Topics include regression analysis, hypothesis testing, time series analysis, and panel data analysis.

name: Mathematics for Economists
description: This course covers mathematical concepts that are important in economics, including optimization theory, matrix algebra, and differential and integral calculus.

name: Development Economics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of development economics, focusing on the challenges facing developing countries and possible solutions to those challenges. Topics include poverty, inequality, education, health, agriculture, trade, and foreign aid.

name: International Economics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of international economics, including trade theory, trade policy, exchange rates, and international capital flows.

name: Environmental Economics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of environmental economics, including pollution control, natural resource management, and climate change.
